abstract: Abid Naseer, accused terrorist who is representing himself in federal trail, cross-examines government witness Najibullah Zazi, who has admitted to working with Al Qaeda; seeks to undermine government assertion that Naseer and Zazi are close acquaintances who plotted together in failed coordinated attacks in London, New York and Denmark.
lead_paragraph: Abid Naseer, who is accused of plotting an attack in England, did his best to undermine the testimony of a government witness who has admitted to working with Al Qaeda.

headline.main: Acting as His Own Attorney, Defendant in Bomb Case Cross-Examines a Witness
headline.print_headline: Defendant Tries to Foil a Witness at His Trial

snippet: Abid Naseer, who is accused of plotting an attack in England, did his best to undermine the testimony of a government witness who has admitted to working with Al Qaeda.
